input.description: adapter name [Optional] The name of the adapter that is enabled on the Peer. The default adapter name is IBMTSMActor

The preview backup command simulates a backup command without sending data to the server.
Sample Request XML:
<items> <item> <operation-name>preview-backup</operation-name> <command-options> <filter>all</filter> <filename>C:\output.txt</filename> <traverse>Yes</traverse> <console></console> </command-options> <command-arguments> <filespec>C:\sampl.txt</filespec> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
Command Arguments Description
filespec[Required] Specifies the path and file name that you want to backup. Use wildcard characters to select a group of files or all of the files in a directory.
Command Options Description
filter[Optional] Specifies the output to display - included objects, excluded objects, or both. Valid values: ALL Display output for included and excluded objects. This is the default.
INCL Display output for included objects only.
EXCL Display output for excluded objects only.
filename[Optional] Specifies the filename in which to write the tab-delineated output. The default is dsmprev.txt.
console[Optional] Output is written to the console, and the file.
traverse[Optional] Preview the current directory and subdirectories. Valid values: Yes Preview the current directories and subdirectories. This is the default.
No Preview only the current directory, not subdirectories.
Note: Specifying -traverse does not preview directories excluded using the exclude.dir option.

documentation.description: This wrapper simulates a backup command without sending data to the server.
